subject: A new look at JUnit's tests
msgSnippet: All, As part of JUnitMax I have been looking for new ways to get value from tests. One recent experiment was interesting to me, so I thought I would share it
messageBody:
All,

As part of JUnitMax I have been looking for new ways to get value from
tests. One recent experiment was interesting to me, so I thought I would
share it here. I took the words in the names of JUnit's own tes suite and
fed them to Wordle, resulting in this picture:

http://www.wordle.net/gallery/wrdl/359579/JUnit_Tests

The biggest surprise for me was the size of "arrays". The number of tests
for array equality is completely out of proportion to the value of having
assertEquals be clever arrays.

Cheers,

Kents
